com.gensym.core
Class UiApplication

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.gensym.core.GensymApplication
        |
        +--com.gensym.core.UiApplication
public abstract class UiApplication
extends GensymApplication

A Class that can be used as the parent of all User Interface applications. It provides support for getting the Frame (or the current Frame of a multiple Frame application) and handling of command-line options.

Method Detail

isMultipleFrameApplication

public static boolean isMultipleFrameApplication()
Indicates whether this application supports multiple Frames
Returns:
true if this application opens multiple Frames, false otherwise

setCurrentFrame

protected static void setCurrentFrame(Frame frame)
This sets the current Frame (which will be returned by getCurrentFrame). Subclasses that support multiple Frames may use this.
Parameters:
frame - the current Frame

getCurrentFrame

public static Frame getCurrentFrame()
Returns the current Frame of the application. This can be used in the presentation of dialogs etc.
Returns:
the current Frame of this UIApplication

setBoundsForFrame

protected static void setBoundsForFrame(Frame frame,
                                        String geometry)
Modifies the bounds of the Frame to fit into the specified geometry.
Parameters:
frame - the Frame to resize
geometry - the geometry specified in the form w x h + x + y

getTitleInformation

public static String getTitleInformation()
Returns the title string, if one was requested in the command line passed to the constructor.
Returns:
the requested title for the application Frame

getGeometryInformation

public static String getGeometryInformation()
Returns the requested geometry. If no geometry was requested on the command line, null is returned
Returns:
a String specifying the desired bounds for the application Frame

parseBounds

protected static Rectangle parseBounds(String optn)
Parses standard X argument for geometry. It takes a String of the form "widthxheight[+-]{-}x[+-]{-}y" and returns the bounds specifed. The x and y components are the offsets from the edges of the screen. A positive x or y indicates a margin on the left or top and a negative y indicates a margin on the bottom or right. If any of the components are missing, the corresponding component of the default geometry 900x700+0+0 is used
Parameters:
optn - a String of the form wxh+x+y
Returns:
a Rectangle outlining the desired bounds
